meanings.definition: Toward the inside or center of a playing area, as in basketball.
meanings.sent1: The basketball was passed inbounds to the point guard.
meanings.sent2: Players must stay inbounds during the game to avoid penalties.
meanings.sent3: The ball bounced inbounds, narrowly missing the referee's foot.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed inbounds, reaching every player on the court.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the ball landed inbounds, keeping the game alive.

meanings.definition: Within the boundaries or limits of a specified area.
meanings.sent1: The inbounds pass was caught by the forward for an easy layup.
meanings.sent2: The team celebrated their victory within the inbounds area.
meanings.sent3: The cat stayed inbounds of the backyard, chasing butterflies.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were always inbounds, never straying into controversial territory.
meanings.sent5: The treasure was hidden inbounds of the old, abandoned house.
